metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3700 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in usbredir in versions prior to0.11.0 in the usbredirparser_serialize() inusbredirparser/usbredirparser.c. This issue occurs when serializing largeamounts of buffered write data in the case of a slow or blockeddestination.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libusbredirhost1 - 0.7.1-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
libusbredirparser1 - 0.7.1-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
usbredirserver - 0.7.1-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: usbredir package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.1-1ubuntu0.18.04.1').
